name: Wine Valley Inn & Cottages

reviews.title: Chimney Sweep Inn
reviews.text: This is the perfect place for a romantic getaway. Try to stay in one of the private cottages!!! Beautiful grounds and very nice staff!

We stayed in a queen room with a fireplace. The room was very large and clean. The Friday evening wine-tasting event sponsored by the Inn was lovely as it provided us with a chance to meet other guests. The complimentary breakfast was filling. It is quite centrally located to many wine tasting rooms in the vicinity. I will stay at this Inn for future wine tasting trips.
reviews.title: Great Inn!

reviews.text: Okay. I have stayed in the regular "fire deluxe rooms" and recently stayed in the #1 Tuscany Cottage. There is no comparison. The cottage was beautiful. It is a huge two story cottage with a fireplace downstairs and upstairs. The decorating is so pretty and is not "hotel like" at all. You have a private backyard with your own private jacuzzi(although we did not use it). You also have a bathroom upstairs and down. The pretty gardens that people are saying don't exist, do exist but they are in the cottage area. I will stay in the cottages again for sure. So wonderful...
reviews.title: stay in the cottage

reviews.text: This was not our first experience at the Inn, but it will be our last. We originally stayed when it was the Tivoli Inn and loved it!! Our second trip didn't go as well, but since the Inn had changed hands again, we decided to give it another try. Third time was not the charm. Our original deluxe room was extremely small (and since we had stayed before, we knew what the other rooms looked like). We were not happy about the room we were given, but were willing to live with it. When we were woken up in the middle of the night by a loud, continuous thumping noise, we decided we needed to do something (the rain gutters outside emptied right on top of the heating unit in our room and the rain became amplified and echoed into the room). When we complained about the noise, we were told there was nothing they could do about it and that nobody else had complained about it (insinuating to us that we were either lying or nuts). Since we had booked the entire weekend, they did agree to give us another room, which was a vast improvement and more what we were expecting. My husband and I love to have a 'get-away' weekend in Solvang and we have no complaints about the room we eventually got, but the attitude of the front desk staff but a damper on the weekend. The hotel is quaint, but it's not worth it to deal with the staff.
reviews.title: Won't be back.

reviews.text: We got the manager's special on a Thursday, just $72, very nice and on the third floor, but one of the smallest rooms of the deluxe fireplace rooms. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom had beautiful tile and the huge shower had a window overlooking the town. The fireplace was nice but only burns wax logs. The cottages have regular fireplaces that burn real wood. At check-in, we were told that they have free wireless internet (not mentioned on their website). We peaked around the next day while the maids were cleaning and each of the deluxe fireplace rooms is different, some very large with whole living rooms. The breakfast room was large and the breakfast good enough (with fresh danish pastries from a local bakery) that we weren't tempted to go out to eat. We had no problems with noise the night we were there. We'll come back again, and next time get one of the larger rooms.
reviews.title: Great Place
no acreage of gardens in view
reviews.text: We signed up for a room based on the website of this hotel which made it seem luxurious and on lots of greenery, and because they were "dog friendly." I should have known when they said they charge a $100 pet cleaning fee, in additon to the $$ each night. the $100 gets refunded if the room is clean.
We booked our reservation through a travel website and got a rate of $64 midweek.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
Cottages not cheap but worth pampering yourselves!
reviews.text: PROS: Driving into Solvang, I was pleasantly surprised that the WVI was at the beginning of the downtown shopping village - so you didn't have far to walk to go shopping, wine-tasting downtown, or dining. The room was very spacious - we were on the 3rd floor by the clocktower. The room had a fireplace and an armoire. The bathroom was pretty big and had furniture in it. Overall, the decor was very hospitable, "old", and tasteful. In the morning we went to breakfast which was free, in a beautiful room, had friendly people and wait staff, and was quite adequate (hard boiled eggs, bagels, toaster waffles, cereal, etc)

CONS: The elevator only went to the 2nd floor (and we were on the 3rd). This is not such a big problem except it emphasized to me how crazy a maze of staircases there were in that particular building. Too often I thought of what would happen in the event of a fire - would I find my way down/out. Honestly - if you pick the wrong direction, you might have to go down and then up again to get down again. No kidding. It sure would help if everything were better marked! I guess the fire thing occurred to me since the building itself looked like it needed some repair and a good paint job. Our room, room 311, had so much light coming in (even at night, since there was a bright bulb outside our room) that I had to move a chair with a towel draped over it to cover up the window that was "on the floor" and another towel over the door's window. My suggestion is simply to provide some drapes. The TV wasn't small as someone had mentioned but it was very far away from the bed so it seemed small.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Overall, I liked this place and thought it was a good value.
reviews.title: Charming Inn
Very Sweet Inn
reviews.text: When we arrived in Solvang we checked out the rooms at the Wine Valley Inn. They were OK but then we asked to look at the cottages and were hooked! We got a lovely cottage at the back of the property (#6) with its own Jaccuzi. There was also a private parking space underneath the cottage and steps leading up to the property, which was ideal for us.

We chose the WVI because of a " manager's special"...$65 on a Thurs. wonderful value! We saw a show at the Chumash casino and retreated to Solvang for the evening. Split level room with large bath, Queen bed, and fold out couch with table. Outside sitting/eating area was great for morning coffee. This town rolls up the side walks after dark. Not much to do in town or at the Inn. This place is VERY QUIET. Breakfast was OK but why eat their store-bought bagels when there are fine Danish bakeries across the street? Strolled through town from the Inn and drove 6 miles to Los Olivos for Lunch. Wonderful mid-week getaway. Walkable to Solvang restaurants and PCPA theater. Five/ten minute drive to Chumash casino and town of Los Olivos.
reviews.title: great value in the heart of Solvang

reviews.text: We book our room back on Jan 2nd to make sure that we would have a nice room. I booked it on their web-site and then later that day called to confim the reservation. We were to have the Deluxe Queen with a fireplace. The rooms on their website looked charming, some with 4 poster beds. When we arrived we were given a very small room with no fireplace and no fancy bed. (very standard). I went back to the front desk and told them that the room was not what I had reserved. The young man at the desk said there were no other rooms avaible until the next evening and that maybe he could put us up in the cottage for (1) night. He did and the cottage was beautiful! The next evening we were moved out of the cottage and given another room. It was what they considered to be the delux queen. Again it was nothing spectacular very standard. There were no other rooms open so we did stick it out for the next few days. I have posted some pictures so you can see what the delux room looks like. If you are planning a romantic time I would stick with a cottage. The delux room is very small and the showers are as well.
reviews.title: Not what we expected by the pictures you see on their web-site.

reviews.text: We decided to stay in Solvang in order break up our long trip to San Diego. I found the Wine Valley Inn on the Internet and booked their 2-story loft room at the Manager's Special rate of $69. It was well-worth that rate. Would probably have paid even more. Our room (#42) was very lovely. It felt like a mini-townhome with the living area and bathroom on the lower level and the bedroom with king-sized bed in the upstairs loft. It was nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. The location of the hotel is within perfect walking distance to downtown Solvang. The gardens around the hotel are beautiful and the deluxe separate cottages looked absolutely darling. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, no problems whatsoever. If I had to say anything negative, it might be that the breakfast was just OK, some fresh fruit or fruit salad would have been nice. Also, their towels were thin and rough. Finally, the town of Solvang is not as lively as it used to be, probably a result of the economy. Shopping was disappointing. But, The Wine Valley Inn was terrific and we would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Wonderful Place!

reviews.text: Our long awaited stay in Cottage #2 started out as less than wonderfully. The downstairs decor was quite dated, and clearly had a "Daniel Boone" theme going on. I hadn't even checked the upstairs master before I called to ask for a cottage switch. Unfortunately, you have to book cottages weeks/months in advance for a weekend stay and of course, no other cottage was available. However, upon further examination of the entire cottage, I was quite satisfied. I stayed for 2 nights with some friends (all of whom loved it & can't wait to go back). French doors lead to a private deck & jacuzzi, treetop views, beautiful and spacious master upstairs also with French doors and small deck. Yeah, a bit rustic on the bathroom decor and downstairs floor, but can't even compare to Cottage #4 (first stay in Feb '06), which I thought was a nice upstairs cottage.
reviews.title: Cottage #2 is the way to go!
Above average
reviews.text: Was pleasantly pleased with accomodations. Have paid more for less. People were very accomodating. Parking was a little sparce but over all it was a pleasant experience.

aka: Wine Valley Inn And Cottages - a Broughton Hotel
description: Santa Ynez Valley...scenic vistas, vintage charm. Located on an acre of meandering gardens with a Koi pond, the Wine Valley Inn offers old-world hospitality with a variety of accommodations for every taste and budget. The Wine Valley Inn is located in the Danish village of Solvang, within easy walking distance of many wine tasting rooms and within 20 minutes of more than 40 acclaimed wineries & vineyards.
